column4: I have a problem on dapper that even a plain simple .tex-file doesn't compile
you have the appropriate packages installed? How are you processing the .tex file?
yes I believe I have all the needed ones.. I'm migrating from sarge. I'm just running it as "latex test.tex"
nexus6 ~ 5256 % latex test.tex
This is TeX, Version 3.141592 (Web2C 7.5.4)
---! /var/lib/texmf/web2c/latex.fmt was written by pdfetex
(Fatal format file error; I'm stymied)
that's all
and the same problem with edgy
try pdflatex test.tex (which doesn't do quite the same thing...)
that works..
The difference is, that generates a pdf file, whereas plain latex would've generated a dvi file.
the complaint you got from tex seems to indicate that the latex format files were compiled with pdflatex, rather than latex, and their format files are not quite compatible.
that makes sense, how would I change that?
ok, I got it
how? I was looking into that...
thanks for pointing me to the right direction... we had links like pdflatex -> pdftex, latex -> tex
that should be correct.
it should? seems that the default is {latex, pdflatex} -> pdfetex
ah! That's unusual... but seems to be how my system is setup, and would explain why your latex was compiled that way.
so while tetex-bin was configured those links weren't there and pdfetex was used

I guess, since pdfetex is capable of generating .dvi's, it probably does so when its name isn't being prefixed with pdf. Not bad.... most distros I've seen link latex to tetex's version (/usr/bin/tex). Well, glad you got your answer.
